        <category display_value="Batch Install">cb763de3c3031010ca199a038a40dd82</category>
        <copied_from>c2ec71e7c3031010ca199a038a40dd5b</copied_from>
        <copied_from_name>Batch Install</copied_from_name>
        <description><p>Given the sys_id of a result object, this sub-flow will return the installation status of each package along with entire batch plan</p>
<p><b>Inputs:</p>
</b>
<ul>
   <li><b>Result ID</b> -ID of result object corresponding to batch install operation. This ID is returned in output field "Result ID" from "Batch Install" sub flow and action</li>
   <li><b>API Version</b> - This optional parameter allows the version of the related CICD REST API to be specified.  When not present, the latest version of the API will be used.</li>
</ul>
<p><b>Outputs:</p>
</b>
<ul>
   <li><b>Error</b> - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs</li>
   <li><b>HTTP Status</b> - The HTTP status code of the response</li>
   <li><b>Status Label</b> - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"</li>
   <li><b>Status Message</b> - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.</li>
   <li><b>Status Detail</b> - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.</li>
   <li><b>Batch Plan</b> - Result of batch plan as JSON object</li>
   <li><b>Batch Items</b> - JSON array where each object represents the result of installation of single package in the batch </li>
</ul>
<p> To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above <a target="_blank" href="https://docs.servicenow.com/search?q=Create+a+Connection+%26+Credential+alias">Learn More</a></p></description>

    <sys_hub_flow_snapshot action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE">
        <access>public</access>
        <acls/>
        <active>true</active>
        <annotation/>
        <callable_by_client_api>false</callable_by_client_api>
        <category display_value="Batch Install">cb763de3c3031010ca199a038a40dd82</category>
        <copied_from/>
        <copied_from_name/>
        <description><p>Given the SYS_ID of a result object, this action will return the install status of each package as well as the install plan</p>
<p><b>Inputs:</p>
</b>
<ul>
   <li><b>Result ID</b> -ID of result object corresponding to batch install action</li>
</ul>
<p><b>Outputs:</p>
</b>
<ul>
   <li><b>Error</b> - Reason for error. Populated only when an error occurs</li>
   <li><b>HTTP Status</b> - The HTTP status code of the response</li>
   <li><b>Status Label</b> - The label corresponding to the 'status'. Will be one of "Pending", "Running", "Successful", "Failed", "Cancelled"</li>
   <li><b>Status Message</b> - More information on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.</li>
   <li><b>Status Detail</b> - More details on why the operation failed if available. Can be empty.</li>
   <li><b>Batch Plan</b> - JSON plan provided to the install flow</li>
   <li><b>Batch Items</b> - list of JSON packages installed and their install status</li>
</ul>
<p> To use this action, a corresponding CICD connection and credential must be created and associated with the instance URL used above <a target="_blank" href="https://docs.servicenow.com/search?q=Create+a+Connection+%26+Credential+alias">Learn More</a></p></description>
